100/10

Het spelletje is fenomenaal. De game begint met een schreeuwerig doch hilarisch '2K!!!!!' logo, dat brengt altijd een glimlach op mijn gezicht. Daarna komen nog wel wat logo's, maar die sla ik altijd over, want dat boeit mij vrij weinig. Vervolgens kom je in het titelscherm, met een rustige representatie van Columbia, dat je laat geloven dat dit een zwevend Utopia is. Nou, voorlopig weet alleen John de Mol een Utopia te creëren, want Columbia is niet bepaald een feest om in te wonen met al die monsters, machines en racisten!

Je speelt als Booker DeWitt. Je ziet hem eigenlijk alleen maar op het doosje, want het gehele spel is in de eerste persoon. Ik denk dat hij wel een hele stoere knul is. Maar hoe kan Booker - jij dus -  zich vermaken zo hoog in de lucht? Daar hebben de slimme whizzkids bij 2K iets op bedacht, want al snel kom je Elizabeth tegen, je weet wel, dat vrouwelijk schoon dat op elke screenshot staat afgebeeld. Ze is bijzonder handig, want niet alleen weet ze de werkelijkheid nagenoeg kapot te maken, ze kan ook uit lucht gezondheid en munitie maken! Ze gooit het dan naar jou, zodat je niet zo snel sterft door schot- en snijwonden. Daarnaast valt er nog wast te vertellen over dit personage. De subtiele maar toch ook opvallende boezem van Elizabeth was een genot om in de ooghoeken te zien tijdens het verkennen van de vaak schimmige ruimtes. 

Tijdens het spelen moet je schieten met allerlei pistolen, maar in BioShock: Infinite kun je ook van die kruidendrankjes verzamelen, een beetje zoals die van Madam Mikmak in de stripverhalen van Donald Duck. Als je die drinkt, gaat Booker eerst uit z'n dak, maar daarna kun je er vijanden goed mee verzwakken. Het ene drankje is de andere niet, maar er zijn er genoeg om iedereen tevreden te stellen. Het brengt natuurlijk ook een unieke 'combat' met zich mee, al blijft het doel natuurlijk gewoon om iedereen helemaal verrot te schieten.

BioShock Infinite is een game vol met plottwists en politieke parallellen. Dit zorgt tijdens het spelen van de game voor een unieke en interessante ervaring. Racisme en geloof zijn twee onderwerpen die de game in je gezicht probeert te duwen, leuk als je daar op zit te wachten. 

Als je geen kast hebt staan van de plaatselijke buurtsuper, is deze game goed te spelen. Het ziet er ook prachtig uit. De omgeving is een realistische presentatie van een luchtstad met maatschappelijke problemen. De animaties van de personages zijn nooit verkeerd. De personages hebben ook goede models, ik vind vooral het bovenlijf van Elizabeth mooi in elkaar gezet.

Muzikaal gezien zitten er leuke referenties naar het verleden, zoals de klassieker 'Everybody Wants To Rule The World' van 'Tears for Fears'. Toen ik dat liedje hoorde, gingen mijn mondhoeken naar boven wijzen. Goed,hè? Er zitten ook nog andere nummers in de game, dus dat is ook wel goed volgens mij. 

Toch is het spel niet vlekkeloos. Er scheelt het een en ander aan het laatste gedeelte in de game. Ik wil niets verklappen, maar er zal een bepaalde baas een aantal keer worden gerecycled. Dit vond ik eigenlijk best suf, om eerlijk te zijn.  De eerste keer vond ik het een matige baas, de tweede keer was ik verbaasd en de derde keer was ik nogal geërgerd. Maar dat is toch vrijwel het enige wat deze game geen 10/10, 5/5 of Ja/Nee maakt.

Dus alles eventjes op een rijtje:

- Prachtige Visuals
- Leuke muziek en muziekreferenties
- Pakkend verhaal
- Plottwists
- Goede combat
- Elizabeth

Dus moet je deze game halen? Voor €7,49, de prijs van een aantal frikadel- en kroketbroodjes, zou ik het niet laten liggen. Koop ook meteen de Season Pass, als je niet genoeg kunt krijgen van Columbia en Elizabeth. Dit is geen advies, dit is een bevel. Ik meen het.

Bedankt voor het luisteren.
The story rendered me speechless! The art and sound are amazing! Masterpeace!

Игра наполнена многогранными вариациями и новым смыслом. Мы попадаем в летающий город  «Колумбия». Первая задача найти девушку Элизабет и раскрыть тайну появления главного героя Букера в этом мире. В процессе прохождения мы поймем, что чем дальше по сюжету, тем сложнее к восприятию. Открытие тайн и новых элементов в какой-то момент усложняет сюжет настолько, что требуется помощь другу. Мне, к примеру, пришлось пересмотреть объяснение концовок, чтобы соединить некоторые совсем не понятные вещи в сюжете. Поэтому ожидать, что такой многогранный торт из 3-х частей BioShock раскроется легко и просто не получится.  
Проходится игра хорошо. Красивый мир и грамотные перемещения по нему. Проработанные оружия, способности и монстры - превращают экшен составляющую в возможность как прыгать на врага в открытую, так и использовать стелс. Такая балансировка способствует соединению игры и экшена. Хотя временами боевая система и уровни все таки немного не проработаны – то много динамики, то заманчивая  тишина. Субтитры включают полную аутентичность. Даже те, что не играл в первые две части с удовольствием погрузятся в этот новый и необыкновенно сбалансированный мир. Создатели, может в достаточно усложненной формуле смогли сделать отдельную игру, которую приятно проходить. Временами слишком спорные получились сюжетные линии – просто потому что они оказались поверхностные. Но эти огрехи не сильно портят общее впечатление, ибо мир неповторим.  

DLC Burial at Sea - Episode 1 
Возможность открыть тайны, и вернуться в «Восторг». Воюешь под водой, наблюдаешь за местными жителями. Открываешь ещё один вариант вселенных и опять остаешься с большим количеством вопросов, чем ответов.

DLC Burial at Sea - Episode 2
Здесь мы играем за Элизабет. Она как хрупкая героиня – используется один стелс и комбинации головоломок. Очень спорный эпизод. С одной стороны он открывает большую часть тайн соединяя части BioShock и выявляя хотя бы заключения. Но воплощение и большое количество омерзительных и неприятных сцен, даже для подготовленного игрока оставляет отрицание. А  уже для неподготовленного детского ума – дает плод фантазии на тему экспериментов над другими. Создавали патологические садисты, которые немного перепутали зрелищность, со смыслом. Скрывать страхи за импринтом.  Хотя в плане гейм дизайна эпизод очень хороший и претендует на отдельную историю.

Общая оценка  10 из 10

Are you prepared to get your MindF*&# on? This game and its DLC will screw your brain and give you a migraine thinking about all the time/dimensional ramifications.

Gameplay felt like a retread of previous bioshocks but felt solid.  Story is amazing but a little too timey wimey near the end (this is one game you will talk about alot when it comes to interpretation though).

Basically you have to nab a girl for a mysterious client from a crazy sky cult and things just get crazier and crazier as you find out whats so special about her and what your character has to do with any of it.  Deeper and deeper into the rabbit hole and you see just how F'd these characters really are.

DLC is an amazing look at rapture prefall and definitely worth a play through at the right price.

If you like brain twisting stories and enjoyed the previous bioshocks you must play this game.

BioShock Infinite is one of the most beautifully designed game and carefully thought of storyline I had ever played. Pushing the limits of how immersive a game can be, the possibility of physics' all time favourite questions, it is just breathtaking. 

Don't  rush the game, it takes all the fun out of it. Walk around, enjoy the sceneries, the stories, everything.

Hace mucho que quería adquirir este juego, como un amante de la saga original, y he quedado más que conforme. 

Los gráficos están muy pulidos, los detalles bien cuidados. La historia es atrapante, desde el primer momento te sumergís en la utópica Columbia, una sociedad extremadamente nacionalista, religiosa y fascista. 

A diferencia del primer Bioshock (el segundo, si bien correcto, es un poco inferior) en esta ocasión podemos apreciar como desciende la sociedad al caos absoluto. También contaremos con la inestimable compañía de Elizabeth, cuya AI está tan bien lograda que en ningún momento la sentiremos como una obstrucción, al contrario, ella participa durante las batallas consiguiendo munición, salud y sales (mana) y por fuera de estas, arrojándonos dinero.

Nuestro protagonista, Booker DeWitt, también tiene una personalidad bien llevada, con varios diálogos y acotaciones, un humor ácido muy característico y divertido.

La jugabilidad se siente cómoda, con un justo arsenal de armas y Vigors (8 en total, cada uno con sus fortalezas y debilidades, capaces de combinarse para desatar el infierno. Invocar cuervos para picotear y distraer a tus enemigos? Por qué no una parvada EN LLAMAS muajaja) en ningún momento se me hizo repetitivo. Nota importante para la Skyline, un sistema de transporte personal pero que también se utiliza en las zonas de pelea, aportando un dinamismo tremendo, con toda la acción ocurriendo muy frenéticamente. La rejugabilidad es buena, al pasarlo en cualquier dificultad se habilita el modo 1999, para los gamers más hardcore. Quizás adolece la falta de un multijugador.

tl,dr: Ya seas un seguidor de la saga o un jugador ocasional, Bioshock Infinite sabe captar tu atención, te hará vivir grandes momentos y te dejará con una gran sensación.
i Like bioshock 1+2 and I lowe bioshock infinite GOTY and brutal sea For Me Like Up......

The gameplay is bland, shallow and boring. The first two Bioshock games are an absolute masterpiece, and while the story of Infinite is glorious, worthy of praise, the gameplay falls far short of the mark. I played through twice to make sure (I thought it was me!)  - the first initial impressions sunk once past Preacher Witting - very pretty but nothing to really interact with. The sense of wonder disappears quickly and character development didn't gel for me (Daisy Fitzroy - what a missed opportunity). Only the Lutece twins saved it from absolute dispair.

I loved the tie-in to Rapture but this to me is a major missed opportunity and flavoured by (sorry to say) dumbed-down mechanics. I will always love Bioshock 1 and 2 but I have not purchased any of the DLC for Infinite as the base game just doesn't do it for me. Maybe your experience will be different.

This game is an absolute masterpiece. 

The story is amazing, full of depth and mystery. The characters are memorable, and the ending sends chills through your spine even after your first few playthroughs. Story elements are implemented in the game through audio-logs, posters in the environment and Kinetoscopes (short films). 

The gameplay is extremely addictive, fast paced and fun. There is so much variety on how you want to humiliate your enemies, through the game's weapon arsenal, magical powers called Vigors (Plasmids in BioShock 1&2), you can literally 'roller-coaster' around the game's environments and smash through challenging foes with your Skyhook. 

One of the main highlights of the game is your NPC companion, Elizabeth. No, this game is not an annoying escort mission as Elizabeth can take care of herself in combat. She will find cover and look for supplies (ammo,salts, health, money) and she'll throw them to you when you need them. She can also open up 'tears' in the fabric of time and space, spawning in turrets, cover, ammo and mechanical allied robots.  

The game is beautifully presented. The graphics don't particularly focus on a photo-realistic world, but a colourful and vibrant universe for you to explore. The game delivers with a stunning soundtrack that will numb you as the world of BioShock Infinite just sucks you into its immersive setting. The voice acting is superb, one of the best for its generation with Troy Baker and Courtnee Draper as Booker and Elizabeth respectively. 

There is so much more to write about this game, it's an absolute work of art. Let's just say that it is worth every cent, and I highly recommend this game to anyone who is into adventure, story, mystery, sci-fi, shooters and games with a beautiful universe to them. I applaud Irrational Games and 2K for making this amazing game. 10/10
el mejor juego
10/10 не забываемый сюжет !!!

Der dritte Teil der Reihe überzeugt mit einer neuen Umgebung und einer starken Protagonistin (Elisabeth). Gameplay und Story kommen ebenfalls sehr gut rüber. Und wer die Action liebt, kommt man auf den Skylines sicher nicht zu kurz.

Avevo sentito molte voci discordanti su questo gioco: alcuni lo elevavano a miglior capitolo della trilogia, altri invece le descrivevano come un fallimento totale, decisamente inferiore a quelli che molti considerano il capolavoro del primo Bioshock.

Io vi consiglio soltanto di giocarlo come ultimo gioco della vostra vita, perchè da quando l'ho finito qualsiasi altro videogioco mi sembra spazzatura!

perchè mi è piaciuto tanto? Ha un piacevolissimo motore grafico, nonostante possa non essere il migliore del mercato, una buona liberta negli scontri considerata la sua natura fps, bellissime musiche, un'ambientazione decisamente mozzafiato ma sopratutto (cosa che oramai cerco sempre di più in un gioco) ha trama, una stupenda trama, che ammetto non ho capito immediatamente alla fine del gioco. E' complessa, articolata, tratta di grandi tematiche (religione, politica, razzismo), insomma, estremamente interessante e coinvolgente. Io darei a questo gioco 10/10, e penso sia l'unico gioco della mia carriera videoludica a meritare tanto. E non parlo da fan della saga, personalmente i precedenti due capitoli non mi hanno entusiasmato più di tanto (si sono carini, ma nulla di più). Bioshock Infinite ha raggiunto l'apice, è un film dove ogni tanto ti è richiesto di sparare per sapere come avanza la storia. I personaggi sono molto caratterizzati, e difficilmente non riuscirete ad affezionarvi a qualcuno di esso. 

In sintesi estrema? Consigliato, assolutamente. Godetevelo.
ooft 10/10

BioShock Infinite is a great game that keeps you on your toe's for the whole ride. And at the end, i found myself wanting more as the credits rolled. If i could, i would shake the hand of the man who made this game. It is brilliant and extremely well made. This review can not express how i feel about this game. I will always and forever treasure "BioShock Infinite."

I really enjoyed this game a lot. there are a few things I didnt like but its pretty minor and can be easily forgiven. I will start with the things that made me enjoy this game.

1) The graphics: the game is beautiful and fun to be in. There arnt many games with the enviorment such as this one. That alone made it worth playing for me.
2) The size: the game is huge, and by pushing "N" it will tell you where to go without being lost, but you can still explore and have fun, just push "N" to find your way back whenever.
3) Time: its not a long game to beat ... nor is it short. I like that it only took about 12-13 hours to beat and I didnt even explore that much, I think its a great time frame to beat and you have the option to play more after its over. those are the games I like.
4) The story: it probably has one of the best endings out of any game ive ever played. The end was a masterpeice, I loved it.

Now the things I didnt like.

1) Powers aka (Vigor): Great power but unused most of the time. I only used two of the powers the whole time, and one of them was pretty over powered. Just seemed like a waste of a great feature in the game. 
2) Gun limitation: you could only have two of the 10-12 guns in the game at any time, this sucks cause you find vendors that can upgrade your guns and make them pretty awesome but you can only have two at any given time. Makes it hard in fights, even more so when you run out of ammo which I did a few times.
3) Dying: you can die all you want without much of a hinder, you only lose alittle bit of money which there is a lot to be found in the game. I normally wouldnt complain about this but I think a game needs a bit of a challange.

Well there ya have it, if anything just play till the end and check out that niffty little end twist, kind of a great story.
Bioshock Infinite: Solo dire que es una increiblemente obra maestra.

Wow, just wow. This game is an experience. That's the only way I can discribe it. It's not perfect, there's a two weapon limit (Which appears like it was done at the last minute) and some of the enemy AI is stupid (I.E, Rocket Launcher guys will shoot you when you are right infront of them) and the last level is irritating. But the games narative makes up for that. THis game does what The Last Of Us didn't when it came to relationship building. While that game built it's relationships through overlong boring cutscenes, this game takes a page from Half Life's book and builds it through gameplay. There is a few cutscenes, but they are only a few seconds long and are all in the First Person Perspective. The ending took me awhile to understand, but now I do I can appretate it. A must buy.

BioShock Infinite - хорошие продолжение!
К сожалению мы не сможем вновь любоваться красотами города Восторг, но теперь мы сможем насладиться воздушным городом, с новыми красотами и достопримечательностями!
Сюжет игры выполнен на должном уровне, и сильно удивляет в процессе игры!
Геймплей также отлично выполнен, что позволяет полностью окунуться в игру!

What about disadvantages, I haven't found them. Bioshok Infinite is the best game! Play it and enjoy! And do more cosplays ;)

Metacritic.com did not fall too far off when giving this game 94/100, it deserved it!

If this game goes on sale for $7.49....Dont hesitate to buy! This is a truly great game.

What comes to mind when you think of the greatest games of all time? The ones that change the way you look at the world around you, kept you up at night, even when you were done playing them. I think of games such as Metal Gear Sold  2, Shenmue 1 and 2, Ocarina of Time and Majora's Mask.

Then when you play Bioshock, you realize this is something more than just a first person shooter. It has soul, characters worth remembering, music that reminds you of something buried. It gets under your skin and takes you to a place you never knew you wanted to visit. I look at it as though Bioshock is the Ocarina of Time and Infinite is the Majora's Mask. They go hand in hand and compliment each other so well. 

Infinite takes everything that made Bioshock so amazing and gives it some polish, more style and a story that you would have expected Alan Moore to have written. To me this is one of the most memorable games I have ever played and probably ever will. It is not perfect, nothing is and it doesn't bring any new gameplay elements to the table. Still, what it does, it does very well. 

An all time classic that will be in the top ten lists of many critics for a long time to come. The topics it covers are important and relevant to the times we live in. So, the only real question you need to ask yourself is, "Are you ready to wipe away the debt?"

Bioshock Infinite is quite the story. Like all video games the beginning is very interesting but quite slow. It is only at the very end where everything is explained and everything (action / secret's revealed / etc) happends. I loved every minute of gameplay: to the shooting sequences all the way to the very intersting dialogue and story. If you heard excellent reviews about this game and still are not sure wheter to buy it or not, here is mine telling you to buy this game right now and just play it! What is great is that this game is no way directly relate to the 1st series of Bioshock therefore you can just play this one even if you did not play the first 3.

Hope you all enjoy this game as much as I did!

If you take the most popular book in recent years, you should have the most popular game since The Lord of the Rings, right? Wrong. Though the first bioshock was given high scores it was hotly debated, its cinematic quality and popularity aren't nearly as high as one would expect - compared to a blonde woman or animes such as: Log Horizon.
Amid protests, pending lawsuits, and outright denouncements by Catholic officials, the game got released anyway.
The riddles and subsequent quest allegedly lead to the true identity and whereabouts of the famed Holy Grail, or in other words: some hot brunette with nice legs and decent tits.
Slightly better than your average game. I give the anime Log Horizon 9.5/10
This game I give 9.5 as well, because Log Horizon, if seen at the same time as the game, compensate it well, storywise.

This game looks truly stunning, new talents and weapons come at a good speed and soon i found myself wanting to replay areas just to try a new approach. The story got me hooked regardless how complex it sometimes felt. I struggle to complete games sometimes but when the story and gameplay blend this well would happily replay again. enjoyable experience the whole way through and considering its price when on sale its a steal that people should happily take
This game truly deserves a 10/10 score. It kept me on my toes the entire time. I do not do so well in fps games but this was a great choice.
самая офигенная из всех игра :)

A pretty great game.  

The world is interesting and well built, and the characters are interesting.  The story is... well, the story is interestingly paced.  The first half is quite slow, and then the story's speed keeps increasing to a seemingly breakneck pace. It's almost like the developers went: "Shit, the game is going to be released in two weeks... er, make a series of cutscenes to tell the rest of the story!".  That said, the story is very good although I didn't find Booker a particulary compelling character.

The gameplay is... interesting. I played through the game on normal, being a normal kinda guy, and this lead to some interesting situations. One involved me standing behind a doorway through which the (melee only) enemies wouldn't walk.  The fps elements are average at best, and some of the weapons are highly situational.  I personally played 90% of the game using the carbine and shotgun, though ymmv.  The guns do feel really powerful though (that carbine), with the exception of the sniper.  The vigor system is interesting, though I didn't end up using more than 3 (shock, crow and shield).

Tl;dr:   Good.  Don't expect amazing gameplay, play for the story, setting, and characters.

BioShock Infinite is the most beautiful games i have ever played, the graphic are lovely, the combat is fluent,the powerups and guns are fun and you will have a blast with the story. The game is different from the normal bioshock the fact that you're not in rapture anymore that really made that feeling of being watched but bioshock infinite on the other hand is set in the sky of columbia where you play as booker dewitt and he has to find a girl to wipe away his debt from gambling but it's not that simple the fact that he has to go to a floating city full of racists and men who are half man half machine with a ton of guns which makes it really good and i don't really care about the change of scenery in my opinion it makes the game even better changing it up a little so i give this game a 9/10.
